definition: congenial
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of

sentences.english: I met few people congenial to me in the department.
sentences.chinese: 在那個單位裏我沒碰到幾個意氣相投的人。

sentences.english: Too often, however, collegiality is confused with congeniality (Berth, 1986).
sentences.chinese: 但是很多人常把聯合領導和意氣相投混淆。

sentences.english: In this small village, he find few persons congenial to him.
sentences.chinese: 在這座小村莊中，他發現沒幾個人跟他意氣相投。

sentences.english: What, with the largest portion of your mind -- sentiments -- tastes?
sentences.chinese: 我們想法一致，觀點相合，總之大家意氣相投。

sentences.english: I only let people in who vibe with me.
sentences.chinese: 我只接納與我意氣相投的人。

sentences.english: I found in him a congenial temper.
sentences.chinese: 他是一個和我意氣相投的人。

definition: to form a clique
with a will, you can achieve anything (idiom); cf 精誠所至，金石為開|精诚所至，金石为开[jing1 cheng2 suo3 zhi4 , jin1 shi2 wei4 kai1]
to change progressively
to give shade (of a tree etc)/to shield
political relations
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
to speak face to face/meeting/interview
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
religious order
Zhou Ji (1781-1839), Qing writer and poet
help to the needy/emergency relief/charity/to give to poorer relative/(also 賙濟|赒济)
superior judgment/sagacity
talented field commander (military)
anger against a common enemy (idiom); joined in opposition to the same adversary
the hardships of beginning an undertaking (idiom)
to die in battle (idiom)
to spread/to hand down/to disseminate
